delayedflow analysis in R tidyverse

Michael Stölzle

9/25/2020

Source: vignettes/tidy_streamflow_contr.Rmd
tidy_streamflow_contr.Rmd
df <- read_tsv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/modche/science_contr/master/4ezg.txt', col_types = cols())

df %>% 
    group_by(filename) %>% 
    summarise(cdc = dfi_n(q = q, n = 1:180)$dfi, .groups = "keep", n = 0:180 ) %>% 
    ungroup() %>% 
    ggplot(aes(x=n, y = cdc)) +
        geom_line(aes(colour = filename)) +
        scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(0:6 * 30)) +
        theme_bw(14) +
        labs(title = "CDCs of 4 catchments",
             subtitle = "",
             caption = "", 
             colour = "",
             x = "Block length N (days)", y = "DFI (-)")+
        theme(legend.position = c(0.80, 0.80))


df2 <- df %>% 
    group_by(filename) %>% 
    summarise(cdc = dfi_n(q = q, n = 1:180)$dfi, .groups = "keep", n = 0:180 ) %>% 
    ungroup()

df2

## # A tibble: 724 x 3
##    filename     cdc     n
##    <chr>      <dbl> <int>
##  1 catchment1 1         0
##  2 catchment1 0.953     1
##  3 catchment1 0.895     2
##  4 catchment1 0.853     3
##  5 catchment1 0.816     4
##  6 catchment1 0.791     5
##  7 catchment1 0.764     6
##  8 catchment1 0.747     7
##  9 catchment1 0.727     8
## 10 catchment1 0.718     9
## # … with 714 more rows
bp_df <- df2 %>% 
        group_by(filename) %>% 
        summarize(bps = find_bps(cdc, n_bp = 3, bp_max = 65)$bps_position) %>% 
        mutate(id = names(bps)) %>% 
        ungroup() %>% 
        pivot_wider(names_from = "id", values_from = "bps")

## Calculating breakpoints . . . 
##  0%  25 %  50 %  75 %  100 %  
## Breakpoints ready . . . 
## Calculating breakpoints . . . 
##  0%  25 %  50 %  75 %  100 %  
## Breakpoints ready . . . 
## Calculating breakpoints . . . 
##  0%  25 %  50 %  75 %  100 %  
## Breakpoints ready . . . 
## Calculating breakpoints . . . 
##  0%  25 %  50 %  75 %  100 %

bp_df

## # A tibble: 4 x 4
##   filename    bp_1  bp_2  bp_3
##   <chr>      <int> <int> <int>
## 1 catchment1     6    38    60
## 2 catchment2     2    11    47
## 3 catchment3     3    16    61
## 4 catchment4     2     8    30
exa1 <- df %>% filter(filename == "catchment4") %>% 
    
    mutate(interflow = baseflow(q, block.len = as.numeric(bp_df[1,2]))) %>% 
    mutate(interflow = baseflow(q, block.len = as.numeric(bp_df[1,2]))) %>% 
    mutate(baseflow = baseflow(q, block.len = as.numeric(bp_df[1,3])))

ggplot(data = filter(exa1, date > "2000-01-01")) +
    geom_ribbon(aes(x = date, ymax = q, ymin = 0.05), fill = "red") +
    geom_ribbon(aes(x = date, ymax = interflow, ymin = 0.05), fill = "lightblue") +
    geom_ribbon(aes(x = date, ymax = baseflow, ymin = 0.05), fill = "blue") +
    theme_bw(15) + scale_y_log10()
